lead_paragraph: If you want to be happy for the rest of your life, new books suggest working hard and playing nice; taking it a few steps at a time; watching your pocketbook; and just not trying so much.
snippet: If you want to be happy for the rest of your life, new books suggest working hard and playing nice; taking it a few steps at a time; watching your pocketbook; and just not trying so much....
abstract: Judith Newman reviews self-help books Walking on Sunshine: 52 Small Steps to Happiness by Rachel Kelly, Paths to Happiness: 50 Ways to Add Joy to Your Life Every Day by Edward Hoffman, Power Your Happy: Work Hard, Play Nice, and Build Your Dream Life by Lisa Sugar, The Recovering Spender: How to Live a Happy, Fulfilled, Debt-Free Life by Lauren Greutman and The Subtle Art of Not Giving a F**k: A Counterintuitive Approach to Living a Good Life by Mark Manson.
